```{r}
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data <- read.csv("C:/Users/saura/OneDrive/Desktop/Assignment/BF/Typical_Employee_Survey_Data(Survey).csv")
# Print Headers/Columns
colnames(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data)

# Sample Data
head(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data)

# Box plot and 5 Pt Summary for Age
boxplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Age)
fivenum(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Age)

# Box plot and 5 Pt Summary for Current_Employer_Duration
boxplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Current_Employer_Duration)
fivenum(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Current_Employer_Duration)

#Factor Gender
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Gender <- factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Gender, levels = c(1, 2), labels = c("Male", "Female"))

#Factor Decision_Making_Participation
Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Decision_Making_Participation <- factor(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Decision_Making_Participation, levels = c(1, 2), labels = c("Yes", "No"))

Typical_Employee_Survey_Data[c("Age","Gender","Decision_Making_Participation")]

#bar Plot
# histogram with added parameters
hist(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Age,
main="Age Distribution of Survey",
xlab="Age Group",
xlim=c(20,70),
col="darkmagenta"
)
# Age distribution shows that there are more people in 30-40 Age group who have participated in the survey

# install.packages("ggplot2")
library(ggplot2)
#Counting records aggregating by Gender
ds <- aggregate(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Decision_Making_Participation, by = list(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Gender),  length)
colnames(ds)[1] = "Gender"
colnames(ds)[2] = "count"
ds
# Pie Chart for Participation in the Survey by Gender
ggplot(ds, aes(x = "", y = count, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_col(color = "black") +
  geom_text(aes(label = count),
            position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5),
             show.legend = FALSE) +
  coord_polar(theta = "y")+
  scale_fill_brewer()+
  theme(axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#ebf2ff"),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ebf2ff"),
        legend.background = element_rect(fill = "#ebf2ff"))
#Pie Chart shows Men have better participation in the survey

# Scatter plot Age vs Current_Employer_Duration
ggplot(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data, aes(x = Age, y = Current_Employer_Duration)) +
  geom_point()

#Scatter plot shows the majority of employees are young and relatively new in the organization 

# Data frame for critical Decision_Making_Participation by Gender

df <- aggregate(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Decision_Making_Participation, by = list(Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Gender,Typical_Employee_Survey_Data$Decision_Making_Participation),  length)

colnames(df)[1] = "Gender"
colnames(df)[2] = "Decision_Making_Participation"
colnames(df)[3] = "count"
colnames(df)
df

# creating plot using the above data
ggplot(df, aes(Decision_Making_Participation, count, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity", position = "dodge") + 
  labs(title="Multiple Bar plots")
# Multiple Bar plot shows Men are more involved in making critical business decisions for the organization
```
